## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
#cargar paquetees
```{r}
library(readxl)
library(lme4)
library(emmeans)
library(FactoMineR)
library(tidyverse)
library(googlesheets4)
library(multcomp)

```




#importar base de datos
```{r}
url <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1o4mtAkI1lBgoUzqDT-e7cIhIwh_K5m6CoxAx0ETvwXU/edit?gid=1753270824#gid=1753270824"
gs <- url %>% 
  as_sheets_id()
fb <- gs %>% 
  range_read(sheet = "fb")
str(fb)
```
#modelo estadistico


$$rendimineto=/mu+bloque+prociza+densidad+procinza*densidad+e$$




```{r}
library(lme4)
md <- lm(rendiminto_g_ha ~ bloque + porcinaza*densidad, data = fb)

anova(md)
```



#comparcion de medias
```{r}
library(emmeans)
library(multcomp)
library(multcompView)
library(ggplot2)




```

```{r}
ggplot(fb, aes(x = porcinaza, y = rendiminto_g_ha, fill = factor(densidad))) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(x = "Porcinaza", y = "Rendimiento (g/ha)", fill = "Densidad")

```
#analis multivariable
de la base de datos fb, hacer un grafico PCA agrupado por densidad y porcinaza usando el paquete FactoMineR

```{r}
library(FactoMineR)
PCA(fb, quanti.sup = c(3, 12, 13), quali.sup = c(1, 2, 4), graph = FALSE)

```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
PCA(fb, quanti.sup = c(3, 12, 13), quali.sup = c(1, 2, 4), graph = TRUE)

```


hacer un resumen de porcinaza por dosis para las variables cuantitativas usando tidyverse

```{r}
fb %>%
  group_by(porcinaza) %>%
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE))

```

```{r}
fb %>%
  group_by(porcinaza) %>%
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE))
fb$trt <- paste(fb$porcinaza, fb$densidad, sep = "_")

```

usando la base de datos fb, hacer un grafico PCA agrupado por densidad y porcinaza usando el paquete FactorMineR
